title: Pomodoro Timer App with Cute Aesthetic, Tasks, Streaks & Rewards

requirements.text: Build a Pomodoro timer with a cute, printy/stationery-inspired visual theme featuring pastel colors, rounded cards, playful typography, doodle-style decorative accents, and soft shadows. The layout should feel like a paper planner or cute desk organizer. Apply this aesthetic consistently across all screens.
acceptanceCriteria: Pastel color palette (pinks, mints, lavenders, creams) is used throughout
Typography uses a friendly, rounded or handwriting-style font
UI components (cards, buttons, inputs) have soft rounded corners and subtle drop shadows
Decorative doodle/floral/star accents appear on cards and section headers
Theme feels cohesive and stationery/planner-inspired across all pages

requirements.text: Implement a Pomodoro timer with a customizable focus time limit. The user can set the duration in minutes before starting. Display the countdown prominently with a cute circular progress ring. Play a sound when the timer completes.
acceptanceCriteria: User can set focus duration (default 25 min) via an input or stepper control
Circular countdown ring visually tracks remaining time
Timer counts down accurately and stops at zero
A completion sound plays when the focus session ends
Start, pause, and reset controls are clearly accessible

requirements.text: Add a break timer that activates after each Pomodoro session ends. Users can configure short break duration (default 5 min) and long break duration (default 15 min, triggered every 4 Pomodoros). The timer should automatically transition to break mode and display it visually distinct from focus mode.
acceptanceCriteria: Short break timer activates automatically after a Pomodoro session
Long break triggers after every 4th completed Pomodoro
Break durations are configurable by the user
Break mode has a visually distinct color or design compared to focus mode
User can skip a break and start the next Pomodoro manually

requirements.text: Add an editable 'What are you working on?' text field displayed prominently on the timer screen. The user can type their current task for that Pomodoro session. The text should be saved alongside the session record and displayed in the progress dashboard.

quotes: what are you working on should be able written by the user for that particular task so it should be editable

acceptanceCriteria: An editable text input labeled 'What are you working on?' is visible on the main timer screen
User can type and edit the task name freely before or during a session
The task name is associated with the completed Pomodoro session in storage
Task name appears in the progress dashboard per session
The field is cleared or pre-filled when starting a new session

requirements.text: Implement sound customization options. Users can choose from a set of timer completion sounds (e.g., bell, chime, soft ding, nature sound) and adjust the volume. The selected sound preference should be persisted.
acceptanceCriteria: At least 4 distinct completion sounds are available to choose from
User can preview each sound before selecting
A volume slider is provided
Selected sound and volume are persisted in backend state
The chosen sound plays at Pomodoro and break completion

requirements.text: Build a progress statistics dashboard that displays historical session data including: total Pomodoros completed, total focus time, daily/weekly session counts, current streak, and a list of completed sessions with their associated task names and dates.
acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard shows total Pomodoros completed and total focus time
A daily and weekly session count chart or summary is displayed
Current streak count is prominently shown
A scrollable session history list shows task name, date, and duration per session
Dashboard is accessible from a navigation tab or button

requirements.text: Implement a streak gamification system. Track consecutive days where the user completes at least one Pomodoro. Display the current streak count with a cute flame or star badge. Award milestone badges (e.g., 3-day, 7-day, 30-day streaks) and show them in a badge collection section.
acceptanceCriteria: Streak counter increments for each consecutive day with at least one completed Pomodoro
Streak resets if a day is missed
Current streak is displayed on the main timer screen and dashboard
Milestone badges are awarded at 3, 7, 14, and 30-day streaks
Badge collection section shows all earned and locked badges

requirements.text: Show a cute gift/reward animation when a Pomodoro task session is completed. The animation should display a gift box opening with sparkles, confetti, and an encouraging message. Users can click the gift to reveal a small motivational reward message.

quotes: cute gift options at the completion of the task

acceptanceCriteria: A gift box animation plays on the screen upon task completion
Animation includes sparkles or confetti effects
Clicking the gift reveals a random motivational message
Animation can be dismissed to proceed
At least 10 different motivational messages are included

requirements.text: Implement a custom themes system allowing users to switch between at least 5 pre-designed themes (e.g., Cherry Blossom, Mint Garden, Lavender Dream, Sunny Citrus, Midnight Stars). Each theme changes the color palette and decorative accent style. The selected theme persists across sessions.
acceptanceCriteria: At least 5 distinct themes are available with unique color palettes
Switching themes updates the entire UI immediately
Theme selection is accessible from a settings or theme picker panel
Selected theme is persisted in user settings on the backend
Each theme has a cute preview swatch in the theme picker

requirements.text: Generate app visual assets: a cute gift box illustration for the task completion reward animation, and a decorative app logo/icon featuring a tomato with floral elements.
acceptanceCriteria: Gift box illustration is rendered in the completion animation
App logo/icon is displayed in the header or app title area
Assets match the overall pastel/cute aesthetic

constraints: All Motoko logic must remain in a single actor in backend/main.mo
Do not edit any files under frontend/src/hooks/ or frontend/src/components/ui
No external APIs or third-party services for sounds â€” use browser Web Audio API or bundled audio assets
No real-time/WebSocket features; use polling or React Query for data freshness
nonGoals: Calendar integration or external task manager sync
